behaviors.title: Document directories follow canonical naming and purpose assignments
behaviors.description: Each subdirectory (prds/, rfcs/, standards/, schemas/, theory/, skills/, work/, security/, strategy/, policy/, reviews/, releases/, runbooks/) has a defined purpose that must be respected.

behaviors.title: Document sections use zero-padded numeric prefix naming convention
behaviors.description: Files within document directories follow 00_meta.yaml through 13_governance_model.yaml naming convention with defined content per section.

behaviors.title: Tickets use TCK-NNNNN.yaml single-file format
behaviors.description: Each ticket is a single YAML file containing all metadata, scope, plan, and criteria. No separate markdown files.

behaviors.title: Waivers use WVR-XXXX.yaml format with justification and expiration
behaviors.description: Approved deviation requests with justification, scope, and expiration criteria.

behaviors.title: Skills follow SKILL.md agent-native executable specification format
behaviors.description: Agent-native executable specification containing capabilities, instructions, and reference mappings.

behaviors.title: Schemas directory is the consolidated registry for all CAC JSON schemas
behaviors.description: All CAC JSON schemas and YAML structural definitions for the APM2 project are centralized in schemas/.

behaviors.title: Standards contain normative definitions for documents, protocols, and data
behaviors.description: Includes enums (strongly typed constants), instructions (normative authoring standards), and cac (Context-as-Code manifests).
